trans-unit.source: Creates a multi selection check box group that can be dynamically created by binding the control to a data source.
In this topic:
[Introduction](#Introduction)
[Specifying List Layout](#SpecifyingListLayout)
[Specifying List Items](#SpecifyingListItems)
[Accessibility](#Accessibility)
[Declarative Syntax](#DeclarativeSyntax)
Introduction
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control provides a multi selection check box group that can be dynamically generated with data binding.
It contains an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection with members corresponding to individual items in the list.
To determine which items are checked, iterate through the collection and test the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Selected%2A> property of each item in the list.
You can also use multiple <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> controls.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control is easier for creating a set of check boxes using data binding, while the individual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control gives you greater control over layout.
Specifying List Layout

You can specify the way the list is displayed by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatLayout%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatDirection%2A> properties.
For information about layout options, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> enumeration.
By default, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatDirection%2A> is set to `RepeatDirection.Vertical`.
Setting this property to `RepeatDirection.Horizontal` renders the list horizontally.
Some <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatLayout%2A> settings do not allow horizontal layout.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> enumeration.
Specifying List Items

To specify items that you want to appear in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control, place a `ListItem` element for each entry between the opening and closing tags of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control also supports data binding.
To bind the control to a data source, first create a data source, such as one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceControl> objects, that contains the items to display in the control.
Next, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.DataBind%2A> method to bind the data source to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataValueField%2A> properties to specify which field in the data source to bind to the `Text` and `Value` properties of each list item in the control, respectively.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control will now display the information from the data source.

To determine the selected items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control, iterate through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection and test the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Selected%2A> property of each item in the collection.
This control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script.
Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application.
You can use validation controls to verify user input before displaying the input text in a control.
ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input.

For more information, see [Securing Standard Controls](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f3e7718f-63d0-44a3-bd5f-48cc2059c2a8), [How to: Protect Against Script Exploits in a Web Application by Applying HTML Encoding to Strings](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/6f67973f-dda0-45a1-ba9d-e88532d7dc5b), and [Validating User Input in ASP.NET Web Pages](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4ad3dacb-89e0-4cee-89ac-40a3f2a85461).
Accessibility

For information about how to configure this control so that it generates markup that conforms to accessibility standards, see [Accessibility in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7e3ce9c4-6b7d-4fb1-94b5-72cf2a44fe13) and [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/847a37e3-ce20-41da-b0d3-7dfb0fdae9a0).
Declarative Syntax
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> class.
Gets or sets the distance (in pixels) between the border and contents of the cell.
Use this property to control the spacing between the contents of a cell and the cell's border in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.
The padding amount specified is added to all four sides of a cell with the height of the tallest cell and width of the widest cell in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.
The resulting cell size is applied uniformly to all cells in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.
The distance (in pixels) between the border and contents of the cell.
The default is -1, which indicates this property is not set.
Gets or sets the distance (in pixels) between cells.
Use this property to control the spacing between individual cells in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.
This property is applied both vertically and horizontally.
The distance (in pixels) between cells.
The default is `-1`, which indicates that this property is not set.
Creates a style object that is used internally by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> control to implement all style related properties.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.CreateControlStyle%2A> method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that contains the style properties of the control.
Searches the current naming container for a server control with the specified ID and path offset.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.FindControl(System.String,System.Int32)"></xref> method always returns the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.FindControl%2A> method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.FindControl%2A> method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method of the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> class.
You should not override this version of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method.
The identifier for the control to find.
The number of controls up the page control hierarchy needed to reach a naming container.
The current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref>.
Retrieves the style of the specified item type at the specified index in the list control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.GetItemStyle%2A> method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> class.
The style attribute for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control applies to all list items that are contained by the control.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> to examine or set the style attribute for the control and its list items.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType"></xref> enumeration values.
An ordinal index that specifies the location of the item in the list control.
`null`, indicating that style attributes are not set on individual list items in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> control.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> control contains a footer section.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.HasFooter%2A> property is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> class.

Footers are not supported when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.UnorderedList> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.OrderedList>.
`false`, indicating that a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> does not contain a footer section.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> control contains a heading section.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.HasHeader%2A> property is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> class.

Headers are not supported when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.UnorderedList> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.OrderedList>.
`false`, indicating that a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> does not contain a heading section.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> control contains a separator between items in the list.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.HasSeparators%2A> method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> class.

Separators are not supported when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.UnorderedList> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.OrderedList>.
`false`, indicating that a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> does not contain separators.
Processes the posted data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.LoadPostData%2A> method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.LoadPostData%2A> method indicates whether the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control has changed.
In other words, it determines whether each list item in the control has the same <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Selected%2A> value as the last posted value.

A user selecting or clearing an item in the control changes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Selected%2A> property value for the corresponding <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.
If the same list items are selected in the control, or if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> is disabled, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.LoadPostData%2A> returns `false`.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.LoadPostData%2A> method returns `true` for a control, the page framework invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method for the control.
The key identifier for the control, used to index the specified in the postCollection parameter.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> that contains value information indexed by control identifiers.
`true` if the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> is different from the last posting; otherwise, `false`.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Init"></xref> event.
An object that contains event data.
Configures the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> control prior to rendering on the client.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.OnPreRender%2A> method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.OnPreRender%2A> method allows derived classes to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender> event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.OnPreRender%2A> method performs any necessary prerendering steps prior to saving view state and rendering content for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList>.

The individual list items contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control are initialized for rendering using the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.AutoPostBack%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.CausesValidation%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.ValidationGroup%2A> values.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Notifies the ASP.NET application that the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> control has changed.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> class.

The page framework calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method on a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.LoadPostData%2A> method indicates that the state of the list items have changed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnSelectedIndexChanged%2A> method to raise the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndexChanged> event.

Control developers can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnSelectedIndexChanged%2A> method to perform custom processing when the user selects or clears list items in the control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method can optionally perform validation before raising the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndexChanged> event for the control.

To validate a group of controls on the page when a list item within the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> is selected, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.AutoPostBack%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.CausesValidation%2A> properties to `true`, and specify the group of controls to validate in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.ValidationGroup%2A> property.
Displays the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> on the client.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.Render%2A> method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.Render%2A> implementation for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control initializes a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo> object for the list, and calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RenderRepeater%2A> method, which in turn uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RenderItem%2A> method to render individual check box list items.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that contains the output stream for rendering on the client.
Renders a list item in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> control.
This method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.Render%2A> implementation for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RenderRepeater%2A> method, which in turn uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RenderItem%2A> method to render individual checkbox list items.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RenderItem%2A> method for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control ignores the `itemType` and `repeatInfo` parameters.
The `repeatIndex` value is used to select the checkbox list item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection, and the selected list item is rendered to the output stream.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType"></xref> enumeration values.
An ordinal index that specifies the location of the item in the list control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo"></xref> object that represents the information used to render the item in the list.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object that represents the output stream to render HTML content on the client.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control is rendered when the data source has no data or the control is not data-bound.
`true` if the control is rendered when the data source has no data or the control is not data-bound; otherwise `false`.
Gets or sets the number of columns to display in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> control.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.Table>, you can use this property to specify the number of columns that display in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.
If this property is not set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control displays all list items in a single column.
The number of columns to display in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> control.
The default is `0`, which indicates this property is not set.
The number of columns is set to a negative value.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control displays vertically or horizontally.
Use this property to specify the display direction of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.
The number of columns that are displayed is always determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatColumns%2A> property.

If this property is set to `RepeatDirection.Vertical` and if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.Table>, the first column is filled from top to bottom, then the next column, and so on until all items are rendered.

For example, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatColumns%2A> property is set to `3`, the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control are displayed in three columns, as in the following table.

If this property is set to `RepeatDirection.Horizontal` and if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.Table>, the first column is filled from top to bottom, then the next column, and so on until all items are rendered.

For example, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatColumns%2A> property is set to `3`, the items of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control are displayed in rows of three items each, as in the following table.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatDirection"></xref> values.
The default is `Vertical`.
The specified display direction of the list is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatDirection"></xref> values.
Gets the number of list items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatedItemCount%2A> property is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> class.
If there are no items set in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatedItemCount%2A> is zero.

If there are items set in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatedItemCount%2A> is the same as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection.Count%2A> property on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection.
The number of items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the list will be rendered by using a `table` element, a `ul` element, an `ol` element, or a `span` element.
For information about the available options, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> enumeration.
Two options are new as of ASP.NET 4: <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.OrderedList> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.UnorderedList>.
Some <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatLayout%2A> settings do not allow horizontal layout.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> enumeration.
A value that specifies whether the list will be rendered by using a `table` element, a `ul` element, an `ol` element, or a `span` element.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout.Table"></xref>.
The specified layout is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the text alignment for the check boxes within the group.
Use this property to specify whether the text associated with the check boxes appears on the left or right of the check box.
If this property is set to `TextAlign.Right`, the text is displayed to the right of the check box.
If this property is set to `TextAlign.Left`, the text is displayed to the left of the check box.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextAlign"></xref> values.
The default value is `Right`.
The specified label text alignment is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextAlign"></xref> values.
Processes posted data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList"></xref> control.
Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.LoadPostData%2A> method to process posted data for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.System%23Web%23UI%23IPostBackDataHandler%23LoadPostData%2A> method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
The key identifier for the control, used to index the postCollection.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> object that contains value information indexed by control identifiers.
`true` if the server control's state changes as a result of the postback; otherwise, `false`.
Raised when posted data for a control has changed.

Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to raise an event when the posted data for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> object changes.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.System%23Web%23UI%23IPostBackDataHandler%23RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser.GetItemStyle(System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType,System.Int32)"></xref>.

Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.GetItemStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to retrieve the style of an item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.System%23Web%23UI%23WebControls%23IRepeatInfoUser%23GetItemStyle%2A> method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType"></xref> enumeration values.
An ordinal index that specifies the location of the item in the list control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object that represents the style of the specified item type at the specified index in the list control.
Gets a value that indicates whether the list control contains a footer section.

Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.HasFooter%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine if a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> object contains a footer section.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.System%23Web%23UI%23WebControls%23IRepeatInfoUser%23HasFooter%2A?displayProperty=fullName> member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface.
`true` if the list control contains a footer section; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the list control contains a heading section.

Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.HasHeader%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> object contains a heading section.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.System%23Web%23UI%23WebControls%23IRepeatInfoUser%23HasHeader%2A?displayProperty=fullName> member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface.
`true` if the list control contains a heading section; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the list control contains a separator between items in the list.

Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.HasSeparators%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine whether a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> object contains a separator.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.System%23Web%23UI%23WebControls%23IRepeatInfoUser%23HasSeparators%2A?displayProperty=fullName> member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface.
`true` if the list control contains a separator; otherwise, `false`.

For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser.RenderItem(System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType,System.Int32,System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo,System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)"></xref>.
Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RenderItem%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to render items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.System%23Web%23UI%23WebControls%23IRepeatInfoUser%23RenderItem%2A> method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType"></xref> enumeration values.
An ordinal index that specifies the location of the item in the list control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo"></xref> object that represents the information used to render the item in the list.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object that represents the output stream to render HTML content on the client.
Gets the number of items in the list control.

Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.RepeatedItemCount%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine the number of items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList.System%23Web%23UI%23WebControls%23IRepeatInfoUser%23RepeatedItemCount%2A?displayProperty=fullName> member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface.
The number of items in the list.
